A complete bibliography and repository of Sheldon I. Pollock's scholarly work.

Home Search Annotate me

Bibliography by Alex Gil. Works shared by the author, Sheldon I. Pollock. Site built using Ed, a Jekyll theme designed by Alex Gil.

Sheldon I. Pollock.
a complete bibliography

Books

  1. Pollock, Sheldon I., ed. A Rasa Reader: Classical Indian Aesthetics. New York: Columbia U. Press, 2018.

  2. Pollock, Sheldon I, and Benjamin A Elman, eds. What China and India Once Were: the Pasts That May Shape the Global Future, 2018.

  3. Pollock, Sheldon I. Philologie Und Freiheit. Translated by Meyer-Kalkus Reinhart. Erste Auflage. Fröhliche Wissenschaft. Berlin: Matthes & Seitz, 2016.

  4. Pollock, Sheldon I., Benjamin A. Elman, and Ku-ming Kevin Chang, eds. World Philology. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 2015.

  5. Pollock, Sheldon I. Kritische Philologie: Essays Zu Literatur, Sprache Und Macht in Indien Und Europa. Edited by Christoph König. Translated by Brigitte Schöning. Philologien. Göttingen: Wallstein-Verl, 2015.

  6. ———, ed. Forms of Knowledge in Early Modern Asia: Explorations in the Intellectual History of India and Tibet, 1500-1800. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2011.

  7. ———, ed. Epic and Argument in Sanskrit Literary History: Essays in Honor of Robert P. Goldman. New Delhi: Manohar Publishers & Distributors, 2010.

  8. ———. The Language of the Gods in the World of Men: Sanskrit, Culture, and Power in Premodern India. Berkeley: University of California Press, 2009. Selections reprinted in Rethinking Early Medieval India: A Reader, ed. Upinder Singh (OUP Delhi, 2010), pp. 269-291; in Global Intellectual History, ed. Samuel Moyn and Andrew Sartori (Columbia U. Press, 2013), pp. 59-80.

  9. ———. The Ends of Man at the End of Premodernity. Amsterdam: Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences, 2005. | Download PDF.

  10. ———, ed. Literary Cultures in History: Reconstructions from South Asia. Berkeley: University of California Press, 2003. 2004 Choice Outstanding Academic Title. Indian edition: Delhi: Oxford U. Press, 2005.

  11. Goldman, Robert P., and Sheldon I. Pollock, eds. The Rāmāyaṇa of Vālmīki: An Epic of Ancient India, Vol III: Aranyakāṇḍa. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1990. https://muse.jhu.edu/book/49040/.

  12. Goldman, Robert P., ed. The Rāmāyaṇa of Vālmīki: An Epic of Ancient India, Vol II: Ayodhyakāṇḍa. Translated by Sheldon I. Pollock. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1986. https://muse.jhu.edu/book/49122. Reprinted Delhi, 2008; reissued in new format, New York University Press, 2005, in the Clay Sanskrit Library (2nd ed., 2008); paperback reprint, Princeton U. Press 2016.

  13. Bender, Ernest, and Sheldon I. Pollock, eds. Indological Studies Dedicated to Daniel H.H. Ingalls. Vol. 105. Journal of the American Oriental Society. New Haven, CT: American Oriental Society, 1985.

  14. Pollock, Sheldon I. Aspects of Versification in Sanskrit Lyric Poetry. Vol. 61. American Oriental Series. New Haven, CT: American Oriental Society, 1977.
